intro: Hieracium chloropsis mutelii, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows and open woodlands, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are yellow with a central disk. It is an annual or biennial plant, often spreading through rhizomes and forming dense colonies.
